message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. It's worth more than $10,000 to us, but I understand its value might be different for you. To start, I'll offer it to you for $9,500.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I'm not willing to go above that. Can you consider my offer?
Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position, but we need to maintain our minimum price to ensure profitability. I would like to counter your offer with $9,000 for the product.

I understand your concerns about profitability, but I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $8,750 for the product. Can you consider this revised offer?

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob. After careful consideration, I am able to offer the product to you for $8,900. This allows us to maintain a reasonable profit margin while still being competitive in the market.
I'm getting close to your final offer, but I'm still trying to save a bit more. I'll offer $8,800 for the product. This is my best and final offer, so I hope we can meet in the middle.
Considering your latest offer, I am willing to sell the product to you for $8,850. This allows us to cover our costs and maintain a modest profit margin.
I'm getting close to your offer, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. I'll offer $8,750 for the product. This is my last offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.
After careful consideration, I am willing to accept your offer of $8,750 for the product. This allows us to reach an agreement while still ensuring a reasonable profit margin.
